channel.title: [TutIsland] Need some interface Id's and 2 extra things [TutIsland]
channel.description: You've heard something like this a million times over. Everyone wants to make that successful 2006scape because RS has changed too much. Yeah, that's my intent too. But I don't care for popularity. I'm doing it for the experience. Any who, does anyone got the interface ID's for the blue bar (tutorial island progress bar), and I assume it's cut down to 15 r so hunks, to 'show' progress throughout the tutorial. Also: I have the void to make my sidebar flash, and the one to create arrow (2 actually). Does anyone know how to actually use these? Thanks all for the help

item.title: [TutIsland] Need some interface Id's and 2 extra things [TutIsland]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

kill boy 98:

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/tutorials/388899-pi-tutorial-island-interface-working-bar.html

Thnx but I only needed the ID.
I got a better code as is:

public void tutorialIslandInterface(final int percent) {
    setConfig(406, (percent / 5) + 1);
    sendFrame171(1, 12224);
    sendFrame171(1, 12225);
    sendFrame171(1, 12226);
    sendFrame171(1, 12227);
    sendFrame126("" + percent + "%", 12224);
    walkableInterface(8680);
}//Tutorial island % bar.
//Used like so: tutorialIslandInterface(30) That would fill 30% of the bar.

Read full topic
item.source: [TutIsland] Need some interface Id's and 2 extra things [TutIsland]

item.title: [TutIsland] Need some interface Id's and 2 extra things [TutIsland]
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:471602”][quote author=silabgarza link=topic=589225.msg4175313#msg4175313 date=1354927396]
interface id for tutorial island progress bar is 8680

and you’ll be using client configs to modify the progress bar percentage
[/quote]
I’m certain I can figure out how to make the bar work, after I look into the Id’s and such.
Thanks for the ID though.[/quote]

no problem
a good way to find config data is by using an interface editor such as rsi

Read full topic
